PROJECT435

  • database1 module

database1 module

Module that contains functions for connecting to and managing an SQLite3 database for customers service.

database1.charge_customer_wallet(customer_id, amount)[source]

Adds the specified amount to a customer’s wallet balance.

Parameters:

  • customer_id (int) – The ID of the customer.

  • amount (float) – The amount to add to the customer’s wallet balance.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the updated customer’s details or an error message.

Return type:

dict

database1.connect_to_db()[source]

Establishes a connection to database ‘ecommerce_customers.db’.

Returns:

The established connection object.

Return type:

sqlite3.Connection

database1.create_customers_table()[source]

Creates a table named ‘customers’ in the database if it does not already exist.

The table contains columns for the customer’s id, full name, username, password, age, address, gender, marital status, and wallet balance.

database1.deduce_money_from_wallet(customer_id, amount)[source]

Deducts the specified amount from a customer’s wallet balance.

Parameters:

  • customer_id (int) – The ID of the customer.

  • amount (float) – The amount to deduct from the customer’s wallet balance.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the updated customer’s details or an error message.

Return type:

dict

database1.delete_customer(customer_id)[source]

Deletes a customer record from the ‘customers’ table.

Parameters:

customer_id (int) – The ID of the customer to delete.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a status message indicating whether the deletion was successful or an error message.

Return type:

dict

database1.get_all_customers()[source]

Retrieves all customer records from the ‘customers’ table.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries containing the details of all customers.

Return type:

list

database1.get_customer_by_id(customer_id)[source]

Retrieves a customer record from the ‘customers’ table based on the provided customer ID.

Parameters:

customer_id (int) – The ID of the customer to retrieve.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the details of the customer with the provided ID, or an empty dictionary if not found.

Return type:

dict

database1.get_customer_by_username(username)[source]

Retrieves a customer record from the ‘customers’ table based on the provided username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer to retrieve.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the details of the customer with the provided username, or an empty dictionary if not found.

Return type:

dict

database1.insert_customer(customer)[source]

Inserts a new customer record into the ‘customers’ table.

Parameters:

customer (dict) – A dictionary containing the customer’s details. Required keys: ‘full_name’, ‘username’, ‘password’, ‘age’, ‘address’, ‘gender’, ‘marital_status’

Returns:

A dictionary containing the inserted customer’s details or an error message.

Return type:

dict

database1.update_customer(customer_id, updates)[source]

Updates a customer record in the ‘customers’ table with the provided changes.

Parameters:

  • customer_id (int) – The ID of the customer to update.

  • updates (dict) – A dictionary containing the fields to update and their new values.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the updated customer’s details or an error message.

Return type:

dict
